tuv.seg: Tracing your birth family
Do theaghlach breithe a lorg
Tracing your birth family if you were adopted or fostered in Ireland can be a difficult and sometimes painful process, and it can be hard to know where to start looking

Próiseas atá i do theaghlach breithe a rianú a d’fhéadfadh bheith deacair agus pianmhar, amanna, má uchtaíodh thú nó má altramaíodh thú in Éirinn, agus d’fhéadfadh sé bheith deacair fios a bheith agat cár cheart duit tús a chur le cuardach a dhéanamh
The process can be similarly difficult and emotional for a birth mother or father tracing an adopted child
D’fhéadfadh an próiseas a bheith chomh deacair agus chomh mothúchánach céanna ar mháthair nó athair breithe a mbíonn leanbh uchtaithe á rianú acu

However, there are specific channels you can use to try and find your family or child, and there are a lot of support organisations that can give you practical advice and counselling throughout the process

Tá bealaí ar leith ann, áfach, is féidir leat a úsáid chun iarracht a dhéanamh chun do theaghlach nó do leanbh a aimsiú, agus tá go leor eagraíochtaí tacaíochta ann ar féidir leo comhairle agus comhairleoireacht phraiticiúil a thabhairt duit i gcaitheamh an phróisis
The same channels and supports are also available to other members of an adopted child's birth family
Tá na bealaí agus na tacaíochtaí céanna ar fáil do gach duine muinteartha de theaghlach breithe linbh uchtaithe
There is no central location for adoption files in this country, so you may have to apply to a few different organisations to get the information you are looking for
Níl aon láthair lárnach ann do chomhaid uchtála sa tír seo, mar sin, b’fhéidir go mbeidh ort iarratas a dhéanamh ar roinnt eagraíochtaí éagsúla chun an fhaisnéis a fháil atá á cuardach agat
Your first step should be to contact the adoption agency responsible for your placement or the placement of your child
Ba cheart go ndéanfá teagmháil leis an ngníomhaireacht uchtála, ar dtús, atá freagrach as tú féin a chur i gcúram altrama/uchtála nó do leanbh a chur i gcúram altrama/uchtála
This will either be a registered adoption society or the Health Service Executive (HSE)
Cumann cláraithe uchtála nó Feidhmeannacht na Seirbhíse Sláinte (FSS) a bheidh i gceist leo seo
In 2005 all 'health boards' in Ireland were replaced by the Health Service Executive (HSE)
In 2005, cuireadh Feidhmeannacht na Seirbhíse Sláinte (FSS) in ionad gach ‘boird sláinte’ in Éirinn
The HSE still holds 'health board' records
Tá taifid ‘bhord sláinte’ fós á gcoimeád ag FSS
(In the past, adoptions were handled by health boards)
(Roimhe seo, láimhseáil na boird sláinte uchtáil)
The adoption agency should have a file on the adoption that may contain some information on your origins or where your child was placed
Ba cheart go mbeadh comhad ag an ngníomhaireacht uchtála ar an uchtáil ina bhféadfadh roinnt faisnéise bheith ar fáil ar do bhunús nó ar cén áit ar cuireadh do leanbh i gcúram altrama/uchtála
If you do not have or cannot remember the name of the agency, you should write to the Adoption Authority
Mura bhfuil ainm na gníomhaireachta agat nó mura gcuimhníonn tú air, ba cheart duit scríobh chuig an Údarás Uchtála
The Authority is an independent statutory body that can grant or refuse applications for adoption orders in relation to Irish adoption
Comhlacht neamhspleách reachtúil atá san Údarás ar féidir leis iarratais ar orduithe uchtála a dheonú nó a dhiúltú maidir le huchtáil Éireannach
The Authority is also responsible for registering and supervising adoption agencies and societies in Ireland
Tá an tÚdarás, freagrach, chomh maith, as gníomhaireachtaí agus cumainn uchtála in Éirinn a chlárú agus a mhaoirsiú
If you are an adopted person, in your letter you should include your name, date of birth, the names of your adoptive parents and your address at the time of your placement
Más duine uchtaithe thú, ba cheart duit d’ainm, dáta breithe, ainmneacha do thuismitheoirí uchtála agus an seoladh a bhí agat ag tráth do chuir i gcúram altrama/uchtála a chur san áireamh i do litir
The Authority has details of all registered adoptions dating from 1952 and should be able to give you the name of the agency that dealt with your case
Tá sonraí ag an Údarás ar gach uchtáil chláraithe ó 1952 i leith agus ba cheart go mbeidís in ann ainm na gníomhaireachta a thabhairt duit a dhéileáil le do chás

When you have approached an adoption society or your Local Health Office in the HSE about finding your birth family or child, you will be asked to fill out a form giving some basic details about yourself
Tá liostaí fada feithimh ag an gcuid is mó de na gníomhaireachtaí de dhaoine a bhfuil iarrachtaí á ndéanamh acu chun a dteaghlaigh bhreithe a aimsiú, mar sin, tá ort foighne a bheith agat
Most agencies have long waiting lists of people trying to trace their birth families so you may have to be patient
Nuair a thagann do bhabhta aníos, déanfaidh oibrí sóisialta ón ngníomhaireacht teagmháil leat agus iarrfar ort teacht isteach le haghaidh cruinniú
When your turn comes, you will be contacted by a social worker from the agency and asked to come in for a meeting
Ar do chéad chuairt, ba cheart duit fiafraí faoi bheartas na gníomhaireachta maidir le cuardach a dhéanamh ar theaghlaigh bhreithe nó ar leanaí uchtaithe
On your first visit, you should ask about the agency's policy in relation to searching for birth families or adopted children
Ba cheart duit a dheimhniú cé chomh fada a ghlacfaidh cuardach a dhéanamh agus cén saghas tacaíochta a chuirfidh an ghníomhaireacht ar fáil duit
You should find out how long a search will take and what kind of support the agency will offer you
Níor cheart duit bheith ag súil leis go soláthrófar an-chuid faisnéise duit i dtosach báire
You should not expect a lot of information to begin with
Go ginearálta, ní thabharfaidh na gníomhaireachtaí duit ach é sin ar a
Generally, the agencies will only give out what they call non-identifying information (no full names or addresses), unless the consent of all parties has been obtained
dtugtar faisnéis neamhaitheantais (ní thabharfaidh siad ainmneacha nó seoltaí iomlána), murach go bhfuarthas toiliú na bpáirtithe go léir
If the adoption society that dealt with your case has closed since your placement, your records will have been transferred to the HSE
Má dúnadh an cumann uchtála a dhéileáil le do chás ó rinneadh thú a chur i gcúram altrama/uchtála, beidh do thaifid aistrithe chuig FSS
If this is the case, you should follow the same procedure that you would use for the adoption society
Más amhlaidh an cás, ba cheart duit an nós imeachta céanna a leanúint a d’úsáidfeá don chumann uchtála
That is, tell your Local Health Office in the HSE that you are trying to trace your birth family or child
Is é sin, déan teagmháil le d’Oifig Sláinte Áitiúil in FSS agus cuir ar an eolas iad go bhfuil iarracht á déanamh agat do theaghlach breithe nó do leanbh á rianú agat
It is possible to trace your birth family or child on your own or with the help of a private detective and some people decide to pursue this option
Is féidir leat do theaghlach breithe nó do leanbh a rianú tú féin le cabhair nó gan cabhair ó bhleachtaire príobháideach agus déanann roinnt daoine an cinneadh chun dul i muinín na rogha seo
However, the adoption authorities do not advise this
Ní mholann na húdaráis uchtála dul i muinín na rogha seo, áfach
They recommend that any searches are carried out in a controlled way to ensure that neither party is forced into something they are unwilling or unable to cope with

Molann siad go dtugtar faoi chuardaigh ar bhealach rialaithe lena chinntiú nach gcuirtear brú ar cheachtar páirtí rud éigin a dhéanamh nach bhfuil siad toiliúil a dhéanamh nó nach bhfuil siad in ann déileáil leis
If you are adopted, it means that your birth family lose all legal rights over you, and your welfare is no longer their responsibility
Má tá tú uchtaithe, ciallaíonn sé go gcailleann do theaghlach breithe gach ceart dlíthiúil ort, agus nach bhfuil siad freagrach a thuilleadh as do leas
This responsibility passes onto your adoptive family
Aistrítear an fhreagracht seo chuig do theaghlach uchtála
Your adoptive name is entered into the Adopted Children Register and a certified copy of the entry in the Adopted Children Register is issued for you
Iontráiltear d’ainm uchtála isteach i gClár na Leanaí Uchtaithe agus eisítear cóip dheimhnithe den iontráil i gClár na Leanaí Uchtaithe duit
Only registered adoption societies and the HSE are legally allowed to place children up for adoption
Ní cheadaítear go dlíthiúil ach do chumainn chláraithe uchtála agus do FSS leanaí a chur i gcúram uchtála
In May 2005 the Adoption Board (now called the Adoption Authority) launched a National Adoption Contact Preference Register
An 3 Bealtaine 2005, sheol an Bord Uchtála (ar a dtugtar anois an tÚdarás Uchtála) Clár um Rogha Teagmhála Náisiúnta Uchtála
The purpose of the Register is to facilitate contact between adopted people and their birth families
Is é cuspóir an Chláir chun teagmháil idir daoine uchtaithe agus a dteaghlaigh bhreithe a éascú
Participation is voluntary and contact through the register is only initiated where both parties register
Tá rannpháirtíocht deonach agus ní chuirfear tús le teagmháil tríd an gclár ach nuair a chláraíonn an dá pháirtí
The Register allows you to choose what level of contact you wish to have
Ligeann an Clár duit a roghnú cén leibhéal teagmhála is mian leat a bheith agat
There is further information on the National Adoption Contact Preference Register on the Adoption Authority's website
Tá breis faisnéise ar an gClár um Rogha Teagmhála Náisiúnta Uchtála ar láithreán gréasáin an Údaráis Uchtála
You may have been placed with a long-term foster family because, for various reasons, you could not live with your own family
B’fhéidir gur cuireadh thú i gcúram teaghlach fadtéarmach altrama mar gheall, ar chúiseanna éagsúla, nach raibh tú in ann cónaí le do theaghlach féin
However, foster children are legally still part of their own family and the HSE is responsible for you while you are in foster care
Tá leanaí altrama fós mar chuid dá dteaghlach féin, i dtaobh cúrsaí dlíthiúla, áfach, agus tá FSS freagrach astu fad a bhíonn siad i gcúram altrama
It should have details of your placement and your own family
Ba cheart go mbeadh sonraí acu faoi do chur i gcúram altrama agus do theaghlach féin
If you were fostered a number of years ago, it is possible that records are not of the same standard that is required today
Má cuireadh i gcúram altrama thú roinnt blianta ó shin, d’fhéadfadh nach bhfuil na taifid ar an gcaighdeán céanna a theastaíonn inniu
Also, if your own family lost contact with you, your foster family or the HSE, tracing your family after a number of years may be a difficult task
Anuas air sin, murar lean do theaghlach féin le teagmháil a dhéanamh leat féin, le do theaghlach altrama nó le FSS, d’fhéadfadh go mbeadh sé deacair do theaghlach a rianú i ndiaidh roinnt blianta
If you were not legally adopted, the Adoption Authority recommends that you apply to the Local Health Office in the HSE in the region where you lived as a child
Mura ndearnadh thú a uchtáil go dlíthiúil, molann an tÚdarás Uchtála go ndéanann tú iarratas ar an Oifig Sláinte Áitiúil in FSS sa réigiún inar chónaigh tú agus tú i do leanbh
It may be able to help you trace your birth family as it is very likely that it was involved in or had some knowledge of your placement
D’fhéadfadh sé cabhrú leat do theaghlach breithe a rianú mar gheall gur rí-dhóchúil go raibh baint acu le thú a chur i gcúram uchtála nó go raibh roinnt eolais acu air
You may still have your original birth certificate, giving details of where you were born
D’fhéadfadh go bhfuil do bhunteastas breithe agat, a thugann sonraí faoin áit ar rugadh thú
This may also be of help as some hospitals may keep records from the period of your birth
D’fhéadfadh seo roinnt cabhrach a thabhairt duit, chomh maith, mar gheall go gcoimeádann roinnt ospidéal taifid ó thréimhse do bhreithe

For more information on trying to trace your birth family if you were never legally adopted or if you are the birth parent of an illegally adopted child, you can contact the Adoption Authority or some of the adoption support organisations listed below

Chun teacht ar bhreis faisnéise chun iarracht a dhéanamh do theaghlach breithe a rianú mura ndearnadh thú a uchtáil go dlíthiúil riamh nó más tú féin tuismitheoir breithe linbh a uchtaíodh go neamhdhlíthiúil, féadfaidh tú teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an Údarás Uchtála nó le cuid de na heagraíochtaí tacaíochta uchtála a liostaítear thíos
Tracing your birth father
D’athair breithe a rianú
If you decide to trace your birth father, you will generally have to contact your birth mother first
Má dhéanann tú an cinneadh chun d’athair breithe a rianú, is gnách go mbeidh ort teagmháil a dhéanamh le do mháthair bhreithe ar dtús
The birth father's name is frequently not listed on a birth certificate and your birth mother will be the only person who can identify him
Is minic nach liostaítear ainm an athar breithe ar theastas breithe agus is í do mháthair bhreithe an t-aon duine a bheidh in ann é a shainaithint
If his name is listed on the birth certificate, you should contact the Adoption Authority or adoption agency that dealt with your case to get advice on how to proceed

Má tá a ainm liostaithe ar an teastas breithe, ba cheart duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an Údarás Uchtála nó le gníomhaireacht uchtála a dhéileáil le do chás chun comhairle a fháil faoi conas leanúint ar aghaidh
It is not recommended that you contact your birth family without outside help and counselling from professionals
Ní mholtar go ndéanann tú teagmháil le do theaghlach breithe gan cabhair sheachtrach agus comhairleoireacht a fháil ó ghairmithe
This would also apply to a birth father trying to trace his adopted child
Bhainfeadh seo le hathair breithe, chomh maith, a mbeadh iarrachtaí á dhéanamh aige a leanbh uchtaithe a rianú
Great care needs to be taken to ensure that the child (and the adopted parents, if appropriate) are prepared and willing to meet the birth father
Is gá bheith an-chúram go deo lena chinntiú go bhfuil an leanbh (agus na tuismitheoirí uchtála, más cuí) réidh agus toiliúil le casadh leis an athair breithe
If you would like more information about tracing your natural child, you should contact the adoption society or the HSE Local Health Office that arranged the placement
Más mian leat breis faisnéise a fháil faoi do leanbh nádúrtha a rianú, ba cheart duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an gcumann
If you do not have this information, the Adoption Authority will be able to help
uchtála nó leis an Oifig Sláinte Áitiúil de chuid FSS a shocraigh an cur i gcúram
Any change you want to
Mura bhfuil an fhaisnéis seo agat, beidh an tÚdarás Uchtála in ann cabhrú leat
make to your legal name (for example if you want to take the name of your birth father or mother) will have to be done by deed poll
Beidh aon athrú is mian leat a dhéanamh ar d’ainm dlíthiúil (mar shampla más mian leat glacadh le hainm d’athar nó do mháthar breithe) a dhéanamh trí vótáil ghníomhais
Tracing your birth family or adopted child is not something you should undertake lightly and you should be prepared for the emotions that this process could bring to the surface

Ní gníomh é do theaghlach breithe nó do leanbh uchtaithe a rianú a dtugann tú faoi gan mórán machnaimh a dhéanamh i dtosach air, agus ba cheart duit bheith ar an airdeall ar na mothúcháin a d’fhéadfadh an próiseas seo a spreagadh
Most adoption societies and the HSE offer counselling to people trying to trace their birth family and it is recommended that you talk to a social worker or counsellor before and during the process

Cuireann an chuid is mó de na cumainn uchtála agus FSS comhairleoireacht ar tairiscint dóibh siúd a bhfuil iarracht á déanamh acu a dteaghlach breithe a rianú agus moltar go labhraíonn tú le hoibrí sóisialta nó le comhairleoir roimh an bpróiseas agus lena linn
There are many support and self-help groups for people who have been adopted or who have placed children for adoption
Tá go leor grúpaí tacaíochta agus féinchabhrach an do dhaoine a uchtaíodh nó a chur leanaí i gcúram uchtála
They provide a lot of information and advice from people who have already gone through a similar experience
Cuireann siad go leor faisnéise agus comhairle ar fáil ó dhaoine a raibh a chomhionann d’eispéireas acu cheana féin
Organisations that offer support are listed below
Liostaítear thíos eagraíochtaí a chuireann tacaíocht ar fáil thíos
Outcomes from tracing attempts
Torthaí ó iarrachtaí rianaithe
There are a number of possible outcomes to any attempt to trace your birth family
Tá roinnt torthaí féideartha ann ar aon iarracht chun do theaghlach breithe a rianú
You may find the birth mother/father or adopted child you were looking for and reunite with them
D’fhéadfá an mháthair/an t-athair breithe nó an leanbh uchtaithe a aimsiú a bhí á c(h)uardach agat agus athaontú a dhéanamh leo
On the other hand, you may find them and discover that they do not want to meet you
Ar an taobh eile den phingin, d’fhéadfá iad a aimsiú agus a fháil amach nár mhaith leo casadh leat
They may have died before you found them or got a chance to meet them
D’fhéadfadh go bhfuair siad bás sular aimsigh tú iad nó go raibh an deis agat casadh leo
Another possibility is that you may never find the person you are looking for
B’éard a d’fhéadfadh tarlú, chomh maith, ná nach n-éiríonn leat riamh an duine a aimsiú atá á chuardach agat
This is more likely if you are dealing with records from the 1930s, 1940s, 1950s or 1960s as those records generally contain very little information
Is dóchúla go dtarlóidh seo má tá tú ag déileáil le taifid ó na 1930idí, 1940idí, 1950idí nó na 1960idí mar gheall go gcuimsítear fíor-bheagán faisnéise sna taifid siúd
All of these outcomes can bring their own problems and emotional concerns
Féadfaidh na torthaí go léir seo a bhfadhbanna agus a mbuarthaí mothúchánacha féin a chruthú
Talking to professional counsellors or other people who have been through similar experiences can be a great help in coming to terms with your feelings at this time
Féadann labhairt le comhairleoirí gairmiúla nó le daoine eile a ghabh trína shamhail d’eispéireas lámh mhór chúnta a thabhairt duit chun déileáil le do chuid mothúchán ag an tráth seo
If you have successfully located your birth family or child, and everyone has agreed to a meeting, the next step is to arrange a time and place
Má d’éirigh leat do theaghlach breithe nó do leanbh a aimsiú, agus má chomhaontaigh gach duine chun casadh le chéile, is é an chéad chéim eile ná chun am agus áit a shocrú
It is recommended that your social worker act as a liaison between you and your birth mother, for example
Moltar go ngníomhaíonn d’oibrí sóisialta mar idirchaidreamh idir tú féin agus do mháthair bhreithe, mar shampla
It can help to have a neutral third party there to make the introductions and ease the tension
Féadfaidh sé bheith cabhrach chun tríú páirtí neodrach a bheith ann chun sibh a chur in aithne agus chun an teannas a mhaolú
Your meeting place should be private and the first meeting should last for a relatively short time, for example, two hours
Ba cheart go mbeadh an áit a gcasann sibh príobháideach agus níor cheart don chéad chasadh le chéile maireachtáil ró-fhada, mar shampla, dhá uair an chloig
It may be helpful to have exchanged letters, photos or details of your lives before the meeting
D’fhéadfadh sé bheith cabhrach litreacha, grianghraif nó sonraí faoi bhur saol roimh an gcasadh le chéile a bheith seolta eadraibh
You should talk to your social worker about this
Ba cheart duit labhairt le d’oibrí sóisialta faoi seo
You should not expect too much from a first meeting
Níor cheart duit bheith ag súil leis an iomarca ón gcéad chasadh le chéile
It can be difficult for everyone involved and will not necessarily dictate the way your relationship will develop in the future
D’fhéadfadh sé bheith deacair ar gach duine atá i gceist agus ní hé go stiúrfaidh sé an bealach a fhorbróidh bhur gcaidreamh amach anseo
Not every reunion will result in a relationship and, for some people, an initial meeting is all they want
Ní eascróidh caidreamh as gach athaontú agus, i gcás roinnt daoine, ní theastaíonn uathu ach casadh le chéile i dtosach
Other people will be anxious to develop a relationship with the person with whom they have been reunited
Beidh daoine eile meáite ar chaidreamh a fhorbairt leis an duine a ndearna siad athaontú leo
This may be a rewarding experience but it could also be one with many difficulties
D’fhéadfadh seo bheith ina eispéireas fiúntach ach d’fhéadfadh go leor deacrachtaí bheith i gceist leis, chomh maith
You should be prepared to deal with the intense emotions you may experience and make sure your adoptive or foster family members understand what you are going through

Ba cheart duit bheith ullamh chun déileáil leis na mothúcháin thréana a bhféadfá bheith thíos leo agus cinntiú go dtuigeann daoine muinteartha do theaghlaigh uchtála nó altrama an méid a bhfuil tú ag déileáil leis
They can be a source of great support to you but it may be difficult for them to enter into your feelings completely
D’fhéadfaidís bheith mar fhoinse de thacaíocht mhór duit ach d’fhéadfadh gur tráth casta é dóibh chun déileáil go hiomlán le do mhothúcháin
Support will be available from your social worker or from the support and self-help groups listed below
Cuirfidh d’oibrí sóisialta tacaíocht ar fáil duit nó cuirfear tacaíocht ar fáil duit ó na grúpaí tacaíochta agus féinchabhrach a liostaítear thíos
The legislation that applies to the tracing of birth families is the Adoption Act 2010
Is é an tAcht Uchtála, 2010 an reachtaíocht a bhaineann le teaghlaigh bhreithe a rianú
The Act does not specifically state that adopted people should have automatic access to their birth certificates
Ní luaitear go sonrach san Acht gur cheart go mbeadh rochtain uathoibríoch ag daoine ar a dteastais bhreithe
However, under Part 10 of the legislation, the Registrar General must keep a record of all adoptions
Ach faoi Chuid 10 den reachtaíocht, áfach, ní mór don Ard-Chláraitheoir cuntas a choimeád ar gach uchtáil
This is known as the "Adopted Children Register" and it is available to members of the public for inspection
Tugtar “Clár na Leanaí Uchtaithe” air seo agus tá sé ar fáil do mhuintir an phobail lena iniúchadh
There is also provision that requires the Registrar General to keep an index
Níl aon fhoráil ann a cheanglaíonn ar an Ard-Chláraitheoir chun innéacs a choimeád
This index allows for connections between each entry in the Adopted Children Register and the Register of Births to be traced
Ceadaíonn an t-innéacs seo naisc a dhéanamh idir gach iontráil i gClár na Leanaí Uchtaithe agus i gClár na mBreitheanna a rianú
This means that details of an adopted child's birth parents can be traced back to the Register of Births
Ciallaíonn seo gur féidir sonraí faoi thuismitheoirí breithe linbh uchtaithe a rianú siar chuig Clár na mBreitheanna
Due to the sensitive nature of this information, this index is not available to the public and you must apply to the Adoption Authority to get access
Mar gheall ar chineál íogair na faisnéise seo, níl an t-innéacs seo ar fáil don phobal agus ní mór duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar an Údarás Uchtála chun rochtain a fháil
You may have been trying to get a copy of your original birth certificate without success
D’fhéadfadh go raibh iarracht á déanamh agat chun cóip a fháil de do bhunteastas breithe agus nár éirigh leat
Generally, the certificate can only be released if the consent of the birth mother has been obtained
Go ginearálta, ní féidir scaoileadh leis an teastas ach amháin má fuarthas toiliú na máthar breithe
However, if you have tried and failed to find your mother, if she is dead or if she refuses to give her consent, you have the option of applying to the Adoption Authority
Má rinne tú iarracht agus má theip ort do mháthair a aimsiú, má fuair sí bás nó má dhiúltaíonn sí chun a toiliú a thabhairt, áfach, tá an rogha agat iarratas a dhéanamh ar an Údarás Uchtála
It will review your case and decide whether or not to give you the information you need to get a copy of your birth certificate from the Registrar General
Déanfaidh siad athbhreithniú ar do chás agus an cinneadh ar cibé acu an fhaisnéis a thabhairt nó gan í a thabhairt a theastaíonn uait chun cóip de do theastas breithe a fháil ón Ard-Chláraitheoir
The Adoption Authority's first step is generally to go to the adoption society or HSE Area responsible for the placement
Is gnách gurb é an chéad rud a dhéanann an tÚdarás Uchtála ná dul i gcomhairle leis an gcumann uchtála nó Limistéar FSS atá freagrach as an gcur i gcúram

The Authority will make sure that everything possible is done to locate your birth mother, and it will look for details of the counselling you were given by the agency as to what you should do with the information contained on your birth certificate

Cinnteoidh an tÚdarás go ndéantar gach rud is féidir chun do mháthair bhreithe a aimsiú, agus cuardóidh siad sonraí faoin gcomhairleoireacht a chuir an ghníomhaireacht ort maidir lenar cheart duit a dhéanamh leis an bhfaisnéis a chuimsítear i do theastas breithe
It is possible that the certificate will give an address or some identifying detail for your birth mother, and the Authority is obligated to safeguard her privacy
D’fhéadfadh go luafar sa teastas seoladh nó sonraí áirithe aitheantais i dtaobh do mháthar, agus tá dualgas ar an Údarás a príobháideacht a chosaint
The adoption society or HSE Area must prepare a report containing all the relevant information about your case and pass it on to the Adoption Authority

Ní mór don chumann uchtála nó Limistéar FSS tuarascáil a chur le chéile ina gcuimsítear an fhaisnéis ábhartha go léir maidir le do chás agus an tuarascáil a sheoladh ar aghaidh chuig an Údarás Uchtála
Based on this information, the Authority will make their decision as to whether or not the relevant information should be made available to you
Bunaithe ar an bhfaisnéis seo, déanfaidh an tÚdarás Uchtála a gcinneadh maidir le cibé acu ar cheart nó nár cheart an fhaisnéis ábhartha a chur ar fáil duit

If you have gone through this process and the Adoption Authority has refused you access to the information relating to your case, you can make an application to the High Court for a judicial review of the Authority's decision

Má ghabh tú tríd an bpróiseas seo agus má dhiúltaigh an tÚdarás Uchtála rochtain a thabhairt duit ar an bhfaisnéis a bhaineann le do chás, féadfaidh tú iarratas a dhéanamh ar an Ard-Chúirt ar athbhreithniú breithiúnach a dhéanamh ar chinneadh an Údaráis
However, this is an expensive process
Próiseas costasach atá ann seo, áfach
Depending on the adoption agency involved, you may be asked to pay a fee for the tracing of a birth family member
Ag brath ar an ngníomhaireacht uchtála a bhíonn i gceist, b’fhéidir go n-iarrfar ort táille a íoc as duine muinteartha breithe a rianú
The fee varies from agency to agency but is generally in the region of €50
Is éagsúil a bhíonn an táille ó ghníomhaireacht go gníomhaireacht, ach is gnách gurb ionann í agus thart ar €50
This fee goes towards the costs of phone calls, travelling and other costs that are incurred during the search
Cuirtear an táille seo i dtreo chostais ghlaonna gutháin, taistil srl, a thabhaítear i rith an chuardaigh
Some agencies do not charge any fee but they may accept donations
Ní ghearrfaidh roinnt gníomhaireachtaí aon táille ach féadfaidh siad glacadh le tabhartais
In that case, anything you give is up to you
Sa chás sin, is fútsa atá sé aon rud a thabhairt
If you know the name of the adoption agency responsible for your placement, you should contact it first
Más eol duit ainm na gníomhaireachta uchtála atá freagrach as thú a chur i gcúram, ba cheart duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leo ar dtús
Details of former health boards and adoption societies are available from the Adoption Authority
Tá fáil ar shonraí faoi iar-bhoird sláinte agus iar-chumainn uchtála ón Údarás Uchtála

If you do not know the name of the adoption society or former health board that dealt with your case, you should write to the Adoption Authority, enclosing your details and ask it for the name of the relevant agency

Murab eol duit ainm an iar-chumainn uchtála nó an iar-bhoird sláinte a dhéileáil le do chás, ba cheart duit scríobh chuig an Údarás Uchtála, do shonraí a chur faoi iamh agus iarraidh orthu ainm na gníomhaireachta cuí a thabhairt duit
If you are trying to trace your birth family or child, and are unhappy with the help you are getting from your adoption agency, you can make a complaint to the Adoption Authority

Má tá iarrachtaí á ndéanamh agat chun do theaghlach breithe nó do leanbh a rianú, agus mura bhfuil tú sásta leis an gcabhair atá á fáil agat ó do ghníomhaireacht uchtála, féadfaidh tú gearán a dhéanamh leis an Údarás Uchtála
You can download tracing guides for adopted people and birth parents/family on Adoption Rights Alliance's website
Féadfaidh tú treoracha rianaithe a íoslódáil do dhaoine uchtaithe agus do thuismitheoirí/theaghlach breithe ar láithreán gréasáin an Chomhaontais um Chearta Uchtála

Information in relation to tracing for adopted people, birth parents and adoptive parents is available on the Council of Irish Adoption Agencies website.
